get.description:
Retrieve clients (applications and SSO integrations) matching provided filters. A list of fields to include or exclude may also be specified. Note:
  • client_id, app_type, name, and description can be retrieved with any scope.
  • callbacks, oidc_logout, allowed_origins, web_origins, tenant, global, config_route, callback_url_template, jwt_configuration, jwt_configuration.lifetime_in_seconds, jwt_configuration.secret_encoded, jwt_configuration.scopes, jwt_configuration.alg, api_type, logo_uri, allowed_clients, owners, custom_login_page, custom_login_page_off, sso, addons, form_template, custom_login_page_codeview, resource_servers, client_metadata, mobile, mobile.android, mobile.ios, allowed_logout_urls, token_endpoint_auth_method, is_first_party, oidc_conformant, is_token_endpoint_ip_header_trusted, initiate_login_uri, grant_types, refresh_token, refresh_token.rotation_type, refresh_token.expiration_type, refresh_token.leeway, refresh_token.token_lifetime, organization_usage, organization_require_behavior properties can only be retrieved with the read:clients or read:client_keys scope.
  • encryption_key, encryption_key.pub, encryption_key.cert, client_secret, client_authentication_methods and signing_key properties can only be retrieved with the read:client_keys or read:client_credentials scope.

parameters.description: Comma-separated list of fields to include or exclude (based on value provided for include_fields) in the result. Leave empty to retrieve all fields.
parameters.name: fields

parameters.description: Whether specified fields are to be included (true) or excluded (false).
parameters.name: include_fields

parameters.description: Page index of the results to return. First page is 0.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Number of results per page. Default value is 50, maximum value is 100
parameters.name: per_page

parameters.description: Return results inside an object that contains the total result count (true) or as a direct array of results (false, default).
parameters.name: include_totals

parameters.description: Optional filter on the global client parameter.
parameters.name: is_global

parameters.description: Optional filter on whether or not a client is a first-party client.
parameters.name: is_first_party

parameters.description: Optional filter by a comma-separated list of application types.
parameters.name: app_type

400.description: Invalid request query string. The message will vary depending on the cause.

401.description: Invalid signature received for JSON Web Token validation.

403.description: Some fields cannot be read with the permissions granted by the bearer token scopes. The message will vary depending on the fields and the scopes.

429.description: Too many requests. Check the X-RateLimit-Limit, X-RateLimit-Remaining and X-RateLimit-Reset headers.

post.description:
Create a new client (application or SSO integration). Notes: - We recommend leaving the `client_secret` parameter unspecified to allow the generation of a safe secret. - The client_authentication_methods and token_endpoint_auth_method properties are mutually exclusive. Use client_authentication_methods to configure the client with Private Key JWT authentication method. Otherwise, use token_endpoint_auth_method to configure the client with client secret (basic or post) or with no authentication method (none). - When using client_authentication_methods to configure the client with Private Key JWT authentication method, specify fully defined credentials. These credentials will be automatically enabled for Private Key JWT authentication on the client. - To configure client_authentication_methods, the create:client_credentials scope is required. - To configure client_authentication_methods, the property jwt_configuration.alg must be set to RS256.
SSO Integrations created via this endpoint will accept login requests and share user profile information.

400.description: Invalid request body. The message will vary depending on the cause.

401.description: Invalid signature received for JSON Web Token validation.

403.description: Organizations are only available to first party clients.

409.description: Another client exists with the same alias.

429.description: Too many requests. Check the X-RateLimit-Limit, X-RateLimit-Remaining and X-RateLimit-Reset headers.

Retrieve client details. A list of fields to include or exclude may also be specified. Note:
  • client_id, app_type, name, and description can be retrieved with the any of the scopes.
  • callbacks, oidc_logout, allowed_origins, web_origins, tenant, global, config_route, callback_url_template, jwt_configuration, jwt_configuration.lifetime_in_seconds, jwt_configuration.secret_encoded, jwt_configuration.scopes, jwt_configuration.alg, api_type, logo_uri, allowed_clients, owners, custom_login_page, custom_login_page_off, sso, addons, form_template, custom_login_page_codeview, resource_servers, client_metadata, mobile, mobile.android, mobile.ios, allowed_logout_urls, token_endpoint_auth_method, is_first_party, oidc_conformant, is_token_endpoint_ip_header_trusted, initiate_login_uri, grant_types, refresh_token, refresh_token.rotation_type, refresh_token.expiration_type, refresh_token.leeway, refresh_token.token_lifetime, organization_usage, organization_require_behavior properties can only be retrieved with the read:clients or read:client_keys scope.
  • encryption_key, encryption_key.pub, encryption_key.cert, client_secret, client_authentication_methods and signing_key properties can only be retrieved with the read:client_keys or read:client_credentials scope.

patch.description: Notes: - The `client_secret` and `signing_key` attributes can only be updated with the `update:client_keys` scope. - The client_authentication_methods and token_endpoint_auth_method properties are mutually exclusive. Use client_authentication_methods to configure the client with Private Key JWT authentication method. Otherwise, use token_endpoint_auth_method to configure the client with client secret (basic or post) or with no authentication method (none). - When using client_authentication_methods to configure the client with Private Key JWT authentication method, only specify the credential IDs that were generated when creating the credentials on the client. - To configure client_authentication_methods, the update:client_credentials scope is required. - To configure client_authentication_methods, the property jwt_configuration.alg must be set to RS256.

Rotate a client secret.

This endpoint cannot be used with clients configured with Private Key JWT authentication method (client_authentication_methods configured with private_key_jwt). 

Note: The generated secret is NOT base64 encoded.

addons.description: Addons enabled for this client and their associated configurations.

allowed_clients.description: List of allow clients and API ids that are allowed to make delegation requests. Empty means all all your clients are allowed.

allowed_logout_urls.description: Comma-separated list of URLs that are valid to redirect to after logout from Auth0. Wildcards are allowed for subdomains.

allowed_origins.description: Comma-separated list of URLs allowed to make requests from JavaScript to Auth0 API (typically used with CORS). By default, all your callback URLs will be allowed. This field allows you to enter other origins if necessary. You can also use wildcards at the subdomain level (e.g., https://*.contoso.com). Query strings and hash information are not taken into account when validating these URLs.

app_type.description: Type of client used to determine which settings are applicable. Can be `spa`, `native`, `non_interactive`, or `regular_web`.

callbacks.description: Comma-separated list of URLs whitelisted for Auth0 to use as a callback to the client after authentication.

client_aliases.description: List of audiences/realms for SAML protocol. Used by the wsfed addon.

client_metadata.description: Metadata associated with the client, in the form of an object with string values (max 255 chars).  Maximum of 10 metadata properties allowed.  Field names (max 255 chars) are alphanumeric and may only include the following special characters:  :,-+=_*?"/\()<>@	[Tab] [Space]

client_secret.description: Client secret (which you must not make public).

compliance_level.description: Defines the compliance level for this client, which may restrict it's capabilities

cross_origin_authentication.description: Whether this client can be used to make cross-origin authentication requests (true) or it is not allowed to make such requests (false).

cross_origin_loc.description: URL of the location in your site where the cross origin verification takes place for the cross-origin auth flow when performing Auth in your own domain instead of Auth0 hosted login page.

custom_login_page.description: The content (HTML, CSS, JS) of the custom login page.

custom_login_page_on.description: Whether a custom login page is to be used (true) or the default provided login page (false).

custom_login_page_preview.description: The content (HTML, CSS, JS) of the custom login page. (Used on Previews)

description.description: Free text description of this client (max length: 140 characters).

encryption_key.description: Encryption used for WsFed responses with this client.

form_template.description: HTML form template to be used for WS-Federation.

global.description: Whether this is your global 'All Applications' client representing legacy tenant settings (true) or a regular client (false).

grant_types.description: List of grant types supported for this application. Can include `authorization_code`, `implicit`, `refresh_token`, `client_credentials`, `password`, `http://auth0.com/oauth/grant-type/password-realm`, `http://auth0.com/oauth/grant-type/mfa-oob`, `http://auth0.com/oauth/grant-type/mfa-otp`, `http://auth0.com/oauth/grant-type/mfa-recovery-code`, and `urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:device_code`.

initiate_login_uri.description: Initiate login uri, must be https

is_first_party.description: Whether this client a first party client (true) or not (false).

jwt_configuration.description: Configuration related to JWTs for the client.

logo_uri.description: URL of the logo to display for this client. Recommended size is 150x150 pixels.

mobile.description: Additional configuration for native mobile apps.

name.description: Name of this client (min length: 1 character, does not allow `<` or `>`).

oidc_conformant.description: Whether this client conforms to strict OIDC specifications (true) or uses legacy features (false).

organization_require_behavior.description: Defines how to proceed during an authentication transaction when `client.organization_usage: 'require'`. Can be `no_prompt` (default), `pre_login_prompt` or `post_login_prompt`. `post_login_prompt` requires `oidc_conformant: true`.

organization_usage.description: Defines how to proceed during an authentication transaction with regards an organization. Can be `deny` (default), `allow` or `require`.

require_pushed_authorization_requests.description: Makes the use of Pushed Authorization Requests mandatory for this client

cert.description: Signing certificate public key in X.590 (.CER) format.

pkcs7.description: Signing certificate public key and chain in PKCS#7 (.P7B) format.

subject.description: Subject name for this certificate in the format `/CN={domain}`.

signing_keys.description: Signing certificates associated with this client.

sso.description: Applies only to SSO clients and determines whether Auth0 will handle Single Sign On (true) or whether the Identity Provider will (false).

sso_disabled.description: Whether Single Sign On is disabled (true) or enabled (true). Defaults to true.

tenant.description: Name of the tenant this client belongs to.

token_endpoint_auth_method.description: Defines the requested authentication method for the token endpoint. Can be `none` (public client without a client secret), `client_secret_post` (client uses HTTP POST parameters), or `client_secret_basic` (client uses HTTP Basic).

web_origins.description: Comma-separated list of allowed origins for use with Cross-Origin Authentication, Device Flow, and web message response mode.

tls_client_certificate_binding.description: Enable use of TLS client certificate-bound access tokens

blob_read.description: Indicates if the issued token has permission to read the content, properties, metadata and block list. Use the blob as the source of a copy operation.

blob_write.description: Indicates if the issued token has permission to create or write content, properties, metadata, or block list. Snapshot or lease the blob. Resize the blob (page blob only). Use the blob as the destination of a copy operation within the same account.

container_write.description: Indicates that for any blob in the container if the issued token has permission to create or write content, properties, metadata, or block list. client_secret.description: Client secret (which you must not make public).

compliance_level.description: Defines the compliance level for this client, which may restrict it's capabilities

cross_origin_loc.description: URL of the location in your site where the cross origin verification takes place for the cross-origin auth flow when performing Auth in your own domain instead of Auth0 hosted login page.

custom_login_page.description: The content (HTML, CSS, JS) of the custom login page.

custom_login_page_on.description: Whether a custom login page is to be used (true) or the default provided login page (false).

custom_login_page_preview.description: The content (HTML, CSS, JS) of the custom login page. (Used on Previews)

description.description: Free text description of this client (max length: 140 characters).

encryption_key.description: Encryption used for WsFed responses with this client.

form_template.description: HTML form template to be used for WS-Federation.

global.description: Whether this is your global 'All Applications' client representing legacy tenant settings (true) or a regular client (false).

grant_types.description: List of grant types supported for this application. Can include `authorization_code`, `implicit`, `refresh_token`, `client_credentials`, `password`, `http://auth0.com/oauth/grant-type/password-realm`, `http://auth0.com/oauth/grant-type/mfa-oob`, `http://auth0.com/oauth/grant-type/mfa-otp`, `http://auth0.com/oauth/grant-type/mfa-recovery-code`, and `urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:device_code`.

initiate_login_uri.description: Initiate login uri, must be https

is_first_party.description: Whether this client a first party client (true) or not (false).

jwt_configuration.description: Configuration related to JWTs for the client.

logo_uri.description: URL of the logo to display for this client. Recommended size is 150x150 pixels.

mobile.description: Additional configuration for native mobile apps.

name.description: Name of this client (min length: 1 character, does not allow `<` or `>`).

oidc_conformant.description: Whether this client conforms to strict OIDC specifications (true) or uses legacy features (false).

organization_require_behavior.description: Defines how to proceed during an authentication transaction when `client.organization_usage: 'require'`. Can be `no_prompt` (default), `pre_login_prompt` or `post_login_prompt`. `post_login_prompt` requires `oidc_conformant: true`.

organization_usage.description: Defines how to proceed during an authentication transaction with regards an organization. Can be `deny` (default), `allow` or `require`.

require_pushed_authorization_requests.description: Makes the use of Pushed Authorization Requests mandatory for this client

cert.description: Signing certificate public key in X.590 (.CER) format.

pkcs7.description: Signing certificate public key and chain in PKCS#7 (.P7B) format.

subject.description: Subject name for this certificate in the format `/CN={domain}`.

signing_keys.description: Signing certificates associated with this client.

sso.description: Applies only to SSO clients and determines whether Auth0 will handle Single Sign On (true) or whether the Identity Provider will (false).

sso_disabled.description: Whether Single Sign On is disabled (true) or enabled (true). Defaults to true.

tenant.description: Name of the tenant this client belongs to.

token_endpoint_auth_method.description: Defines the requested authentication method for the token endpoint. Can be `none` (public client without a client secret), `client_secret_post` (client uses HTTP POST parameters), or `client_secret_basic` (client uses HTTP Basic).

web_origins.description: Comma-separated list of allowed origins for use with Cross-Origin Authentication, Device Flow, and web message response mode.

tls_client_certificate_binding.description: Enable use of TLS client certificate-bound access tokens

credential_type.description: The type of credential. Supported types: public_key.

id.description: ID of the credential. Generated on creation.

kid.description: The key identifier of the credential, generated on creation.

name.description: The name given to the credential by the user.

subject_dn.description: The X509 certificate's Subject Distinguished Name

updated_at.description: The ISO 8601 formatted date the credential was updated.

addons.description: Addons enabled for this client and their associated configurations.

allowed_clients.description: List of allow clients and API ids that are allowed to make delegation requests. Empty means all all your clients are allowed.

allowed_logout_urls.description: Comma-separated list of URLs that are valid to redirect to after logout from Auth0. Wildcards are allowed for subdomains.

allowed_origins.description: Comma-separated list of URLs allowed to make requests from JavaScript to Auth0 API (typically used with CORS). By default, all your callback URLs will be allowed. This field allows you to enter other origins if necessary. You can also use wildcards at the subdomain level (e.g., https://*.contoso.com). Query strings and hash information are not taken into account when validating these URLs.

app_type.description: Type of client used to determine which settings are applicable. Can be `spa`, `native`, `non_interactive`, or `regular_web`.

callbacks.description: Comma-separated list of URLs whitelisted for Auth0 to use as a callback to the client after authentication.

client_aliases.description: List of audiences/realms for SAML protocol. Used by the wsfed addon.

client_metadata.description: Metadata associated with the client, in the form of an object with string values (max 255 chars).  Maximum of 10 metadata properties allowed.  Field names (max 255 chars) are alphanumeric and may only include the following special characters:  :,-+=_*?"/\()<>@	[Tab] [Space]

client_secret.description: Client secret (which you must not make public).

compliance_level.description: Defines the compliance level for this client, which may restrict it's capabilities

cross_origin_authentication.description: Whether this client can be used to make cross-origin authentication requests (true) or it is not allowed to make such requests (false).

cross_origin_loc.description: URL of the location in your site where the cross origin verification takes place for the cross-origin auth flow when performing Auth in your own domain instead of Auth0 hosted login page.

custom_login_page.description: The content (HTML, CSS, JS) of the custom login page.

custom_login_page_on.description: Whether a custom login page is to be used (true) or the default provided login page (false).

custom_login_page_preview.description: The content (HTML, CSS, JS) of the custom login page. (Used on Previews)

description.description: Free text description of this client (max length: 140 characters).

encryption_key.description: Encryption used for WsFed responses with this client.

form_template.description: HTML form template to be used for WS-Federation.

global.description: Whether this is your global 'All Applications' client representing legacy tenant settings (true) or a regular client (false).

grant_types.description: List of grant types supported for this application. Can include `authorization_code`, `implicit`, `refresh_token`, `client_credentials`, `password`, `http://auth0.com/oauth/grant-type/password-realm`, `http://auth0.com/oauth/grant-type/mfa-oob`, `http://auth0.com/oauth/grant-type/mfa-otp`, `http://auth0.com/oauth/grant-type/mfa-recovery-code`, and `urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:device_code`.

initiate_login_uri.description: Initiate login uri, must be https

is_first_party.description: Whether this client a first party client (true) or not (false).

jwt_configuration.description: Configuration related to JWTs for the client.

logo_uri.description: URL of the logo to display for this client. Recommended size is 150x150 pixels.

mobile.description: Additional configuration for native mobile apps.

name.description: Name of this client (min length: 1 character, does not allow `<` or `>`).

oidc_conformant.description: Whether this client conforms to strict OIDC specifications (true) or uses legacy features (false).

organization_require_behavior.description: Defines how to proceed during an authentication transaction when `client.organization_usage: 'require'`. Can be `no_prompt` (default), `pre_login_prompt` or `post_login_prompt`. `post_login_prompt` requires `oidc_conformant: true`.

organization_usage.description: Defines how to proceed during an authentication transaction with regards an organization. Can be `deny` (default), `allow` or `require`.

require_pushed_authorization_requests.description: Makes the use of Pushed Authorization Requests mandatory for this client

cert.description: Signing certificate public key in X.590 (.CER) format.

pkcs7.description: Signing certificate public key and chain in PKCS#7 (.P7B) format.

subject.description: Subject name for this certificate in the format `/CN={domain}`.

signing_keys.description: Signing certificates associated with this client.

sso.description: Applies only to SSO clients and determines whether Auth0 will handle Single Sign On (true) or whether the Identity Provider will (false).

sso_disabled.description: Whether Single Sign On is disabled (true) or enabled (true). Defaults to true.

tenant.description: Name of the tenant this client belongs to.

token_endpoint_auth_method.description: Defines the requested authentication method for the token endpoint. Can be `none` (public client without a client secret), `client_secret_post` (client uses HTTP POST parameters), or `client_secret_basic` (client uses HTTP Basic).

web_origins.description: Comma-separated list of allowed origins for use with Cross-Origin Authentication, Device Flow, and web message response mode.

tls_client_certificate_binding.description: Enable use of TLS client certificate-bound access tokens

post_rotate-secret_response_addons.description: Addons enabled for this client and their associated configurations.

box.description: Box SSO indicator (no configuration settings needed for Box SSO).

cloudbees.description: CloudBees SSO indicator (no configuration settings needed for CloudBees SSO).

concur.description: Concur SSO indicator (no configuration settings needed for Concur SSO).

dropbox.description: Dropbox SSO indicator (no configuration settings needed for Dropbox SSO).

rms.description: Active Directory Rights Management Service SSO configuration.

samlp.description: SAML2 addon indicator (no configuration settings needed for SAML2 addon).

slack.description: Slack team or workspace name usually first segment in your Slack URL. e.g. `https://acme-org.slack.com` would be `acme-org`.

wams.description: Windows Azure Mobile Services addon configuration.

wsfed.description: WS-Fed (WIF) addon indicator. Actual configuration is stored in `callback` and `client_aliases` properties on the client.

app_package_name.description: App package name found in AndroidManifest.xml.

sha256_cert_fingerprints.description: SHA256 fingerprints of the app's signing certificate. Multiple fingerprints can be used to support different versions of your app, such as debug and production builds.

post_rotate-secret_response_apple.description: Native Social Login support for the Apple connection

enabled.description: Determine whether or not to allow signing in natively using an Apple authorization code

lifetime_in_seconds.description: AWS token lifetime in seconds

principal.description: AWS principal ARN, e.g. `arn:aws:iam::010616021751:saml-provider/idpname`

accountName.description: Your Azure storage account name. Usually first segment in your Azure storage URL. e.g. `https://acme-org.blob.core.windows.net` would be the account name `acme-org`.

blobName.description: Entity to request a token for. e.g. `my-blob`. If blank the computed SAS will apply to the entire storage container.

blob_delete.description: Indicates if the issued token has permission to delete the blob.

blob_read.description: Indicates if the issued token has permission to read the content, properties, metadata and block list. Use the blob as the source of a copy operation.

blob_write.description: Indicates if the issued token has permission to create or write content, properties, metadata, or block list. Snapshot or lease the blob. Resize the blob (page blob only). Use the blob as the destination of a copy operation within the same account.

containerName.description: Container to request a token for. e.g. `my-container`.

container_delete.description: Indicates if issued token has permission to delete any blob in the container.

container_list.description: Indicates if the issued token has permission to list blobs in the container.

container_read.description: Indicates if the issued token has permission to read the content, properties, metadata or block list of any blob in the container. Use any blob in the container as the source of a copy operation

container_write.description: Indicates that for any blob in the container if the issued token has permission to create or write content, properties, metadata, or block list. Snapshot or lease the blob. Resize the blob (page blob only). Use the blob as the destination of a copy operation within the same account.

expiration.description: Expiration in minutes for the generated token (default of 5 minutes).

signedIdentifier.description: Shared access policy identifier defined in your storage account resource.

storageAccessKey.description: Access key associated with this storage account.

entityPath.description: Entity you want to request a token for. e.g. `my-queue`.'

expiration.description: Optional expiration in minutes for the generated token. Defaults to 5 minutes.

namespace.description: Your Azure Service Bus namespace. Usually the first segment of your Service Bus URL (e.g. `https://acme-org.servicebus.windows.net` would be `acme-org`).

sasKey.description: Primary Key associated with your shared access policy.

sasKeyName.description: Your shared access policy name defined in your Service Bus entity.

post_rotate-secret_response_box.description: Box SSO indicator (no configuration settings needed for Box SSO).

post_rotate-secret_response_claims_mappi.description: Custom configuration for claims in ID tokens

private_key_jwt.description: Defines `private_key_jwt` client authentication method. If this property is defined, the client is enabled to use the Private Key JWT authentication method.

self_signed_tls_client_auth.description: Defines `self_signed_tls_client_auth` client authentication method. If the property is defined, the client is configured to use mTLS authentication method utilizing self-signed certificate.

tls_client_auth.description: Defines `tls_client_auth` client authentication method. If the property is defined, the client is configured to use CA-based mTLS authentication method.

post_rotate-secret_response_client_metad.description: Metadata associated with the client, in the form of an object with string values (max 255 chars).  Maximum of 10 metadata properties allowed.  Field names (max 255 chars) are alphanumeric and may only include the following special characters:  :,-+=_*?"/\()<>@	[Tab] [Space]

post_rotate-secret_response_cloudbees.description: CloudBees SSO indicator (no configuration settings needed for CloudBees SSO).

post_rotate-secret_response_concur.description: Concur SSO indicator (no configuration settings needed for Concur SSO).

post_rotate-secret_response_dropbox.description: Dropbox SSO indicator (no configuration settings needed for Dropbox SSO).

domain.description: Your custom domain found in your EchoSign URL. e.g. `https://acme-org.echosign.com` would be `acme-org`.
Your custom domain found in your Egnyte URL. e.g. `https://acme-org.egnyte.com` would be `acme-org`.

post_rotate-secret_response_encryption_k.description: Encryption used for WsFed responses with this client.

cert.description: Encryption certificate for public key in X.590 (.CER) format.

subject.description: Encryption certificate name for this certificate in the format `/CN={domain}`.

post_rotate-secret_response_facebook.description: Native Social Login support for the Facebook connection

enabled.description: Determine whether or not to allow signing in natively using Facebook

client_email.description: ID of the Service Account you have created (shown as `client_email` in the generated JSON file, SDK v3+ tokens only).

lifetime_in_seconds.description: Optional expiration in seconds for the generated token. Defaults to 3600 seconds (SDK v3+ tokens only).

private_key.description: Private Key for signing the token (SDK v3+ tokens only).

private_key_id.description: Optional ID of the private key to obtain kid header in the issued token (SDK v3+ tokens only).

app_bundle_identifier.description: Assigned by developer to the app as its unique identifier inside the store. Usually this is a reverse domain plus the app name, e.g. `com.you.MyApp`.

team_id.description: Identifier assigned to the Apple account that signs and uploads the app to the store.

post_rotate-secret_response_jwt_configur.description: Configuration related to JWTs for the client.

alg.description: Algorithm used to sign JWTs. Can be `HS256` or `RS256`. `PS256` available via addon.

lifetime_in_seconds.description: Number of seconds the JWT will be valid for (affects `exp` claim).

scopes.description: Configuration related to id token claims for the client.

secret_encoded.description: Whether the client secret is base64 encoded (true) or unencoded (false).

expiration.description: Optional expiration in minutes for the generated token. Defaults to 5 minutes.

keyId.description: Authentication Key identifier used to sign the Layer token.

principal.description: Name of the property used as the unique user id in Layer. If not specified `user_id` is used.

privateKey.description: Private key for signing the Layer token.

providerId.description: Provider ID of your Layer account

post_rotate-secret_response_mobile.description: Additional configuration for native mobile apps.

apple.description: Native Social Login support for the Apple connection

facebook.description: Native Social Login support for the Facebook connection

account.description: Your New Relic Account ID found in your New Relic URL after the `/accounts/` path. e.g. `https://rpm.newrelic.com/accounts/123456/query` would be `123456`.

connection.description: Optional Auth0 database connection for testing an already-configured Office 365 tenant.

domain.description: Your Office 365 domain name. e.g. `acme-org.com`.

backchannel_logout_urls.description: Comma-separated list of URLs that are valid to call back from Auth0 for OIDC backchannel logout. Currently only one URL is allowed.

post_rotate-secret_response_private_key_.description: Defines `private_key_jwt` client authentication method. If this property is defined, the client is enabled to use the Private Key JWT authentication method.

credentials.description: A list of unique and previously created credential IDs enabled on the client for Private Key JWT authentication.

expiration_type.description: Refresh token expiration types, one of: expiring, non-expiring

idle_token_lifetime.description: Period (in seconds) for which refresh tokens will remain valid without use

infinite_idle_token_lifetime.description: Prevents tokens from expiring without use when `true` (takes precedence over `idle_token_lifetime` values)

infinite_token_lifetime.description: Prevents tokens from having a set lifetime when `true` (takes precedence over `token_lifetime` values)

leeway.description: Period in seconds where the previous refresh token can be exchanged without triggering breach detection

rotation_type.description: Refresh token rotation types, one of: rotating, non-rotating

token_lifetime.description: Period (in seconds) for which refresh tokens will remain valid

post_rotate-secret_response_rms.description: Active Directory Rights Management Service SSO configuration.

url.description: URL of your Rights Management Server. It can be internal or external, but users will have to be able to reach it.

entity_id.description: Arbitrary logical URL that identifies the Saleforce resource. e.g. `https://acme-org.com`.

clientid.description: Consumer Key assigned by Salesforce to the Connected App.

principal.description: Name of the property in the user object that maps to a Salesforce username. e.g. `email`.

clientid.description: Consumer Key assigned by Salesforce to the Connected App.

principal.description: Name of the property in the user object that maps to a Salesforce username. e.g. `email`.

post_rotate-secret_response_samlp.description: SAML2 addon indicator (no configuration settings needed for SAML2 addon).

clientid.description: If activated in the OAuth 2.0 client configuration (transaction SOAUTH2) the SAML attribute client_id must be set and equal the client_id form parameter of the access token request.

nameIdentifierFormat.description: NameID element of the Subject which can be used to express the user's identity. Defaults to `urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:unspecified`.

servicePassword.description: Service account password to use to authenticate API calls to the token endpoint.

tokenEndpointUrl.description: Your SAP OData server OAuth2 token endpoint URL.

usernameAttribute.description: Name of the property in the user object that maps to a SAP username. e.g. `email`.

post_rotate-secret_response_scopes.description: Configuration related to id token claims for the client.

post_rotate-secret_response_self_signed_.description: Defines `self_signed_tls_client_auth` client authentication method. If the property is defined, the client is configured to use mTLS authentication method utilizing self-signed certificate.

credentials.description: A list of unique and previously created credential IDs enabled on the client for mTLS authentication utilizing self-signed certificate.

base_url.description: URL prefix only if running Sentry Community Edition, otherwise leave should be blank.

org_slug.description: Generated slug for your Sentry organization. Found in your Sentry URL. e.g. `https://sentry.acme.com/acme-org/` would be `acme-org`.

external_url.description: External SharePoint application URLs if exposed to the Internet.

required.description: Indicates whether the JAR requests are mandatory

post_rotate-secret_response_slack.description: Slack team or workspace name usually first segment in your Slack URL. e.g. `https://acme-org.slack.com` would be `acme-org`.

name.description: SSO integration name

post_rotate-secret_response_tls_client_a.description: Defines `tls_client_auth` client authentication method. If the property is defined, the client is configured to use CA-based mTLS authentication method.

credentials.description: A list of unique and previously created credential IDs enabled on the client for CA-based mTLS authentication.

post_rotate-secret_response_wams.description: Windows Azure Mobile Services addon configuration.

masterkey.description: Your master key for Windows Azure Mobile Services.

post_rotate-secret_response_wsfed.description: WS-Fed (WIF) addon indicator. Actual configuration is stored in `callback` and `client_aliases` properties on the client.

accountName.description: Zendesk account name usually first segment in your Zendesk URL. e.g. `https://acme-org.zendesk.com` would be `acme-org`.

account.description: Zoom account name usually first segment of your Zoom URL, e.g. `https://acme-org.zoom.us` would be `acme-org`.
